alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 22 at 2:16PM MDT until March 22 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR SOUTHERN LINCOLN COUNTY... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 247. * Timing...Until 8 PM this evening. * Winds...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 17 percent. * Impacts...Conditions will be favorable for rapid fire spread. Avoid outdoor burning and any activities that may produce sparks.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
